info.name: Jellyfish Starfish
info.description: A five-armed amoeba expanding & growing a sixth arm. Similar to my CSS-only demos, e.g. https://tinyurl.com/yck5v3x9 - but quicker, with so little code :D

renderpass.code:
void mainImage( out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord )
{
    vec2 uv = (fragCoord / iResolution.xy - .5) * vec2(iResolution.x / iResolution.y, 1.0); // normalizes and fix aspect ratio

    float angle = atan(uv.y, uv.x); // Calculates the angle of the current point
    float grow = .12 * cos(iTime); // speed of repeated growing and shrinking, with ease-in and ease-out
    float arms = 5. + 1.*(.5*(1. + cos(iTime))); // number of arms, varying between 5. and 6.
    float radius = 0.3 + grow*(.5 + cos(arms * angle)/2.); // modulates the radius with a sine function
    float gradius = 3.*length(uv)/sin(radius + .75); // radius of the blue gradient

    float d = length(uv); // mask
    float c = smoothstep(radius, radius - 1.5/iResolution.y, d); // Anti-aliasing

    vec3 col = vec3(0., .33*(1. + cos(iTime)), gradius);

    fragColor = vec4(vec3(col)*c, 1.0); // Output the color
}
